website_summaries.verdict: An advantageous pair of binoculars with multiple appealing qualities.
pros: Suitable for viewing in daylight and low-light

customer_reviews.title: Galilean Moons
customer_reviews.text: Jupiter at opposition and I really wanted to see the Galilean moons with my own eyes. Tried the HF $20 10x50 binos and the optics just aren’t good enough for planets. I have a decent tripod so I decided to go for the 25x70. Attached picture shows the 4 moons, a bit fuzzier than it should be since I was holding my phone by hand. The 25x70 really needs to be used with a tripod. Also the Barska mount is very good, much better than the one included. If you already have a tripod, get an upgraded mount and you’ll be happy with the 25x70.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Moore

customer_reviews.title: celestron
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes its hard to purchase items like this online. They were extremely long and heavy. Neither my husband or I could see anything through them?? Bought another smaller pair from another company and they are perfect. Not sure if it was us or the product, but they didn't work for us.
customer_reviews.author: sue p.

customer_reviews.title: Great for long distance, short distance or even star/moon gazing!
customer_reviews.text: Great value and excellent Binoculars for just about any use! Great for long distance, short distance or even star/moon gazing!
customer_reviews.author: Randy Garner

customer_reviews.title: Focus wheel broke after six months
customer_reviews.text: These were decent but not spectacular. My 15x70 from Celestron are definitely clearer. The bigger problem is the focus wheel is nearly locked in one position now, only able to do half a turn. While Celestron does provide a warranty, they require you to pay shipping both ways (after you call to get an RMA number), and even then, their "reasonable efforts...within 30 days of receipt" doesn't sound like they're trying to be very helpful. Instead of spending half the cost of a the unit to ship it and then HOPE they will repair it, I'm going to find a replacement from another company.
customer_reviews.author: WB

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy and too unbalanced to stabilize
customer_reviews.text: These binoculars were a total waste; I bought them to help me spot stars before focusing my telescope on them, but they are so heavy and out of balance that it's easier to get my telescope to find the target without them. As an aside, I tried to return them after my first, brief, use, but Amazon's crackerjack customer service people on the other side of the globe would not process the return! After an hour and a half on the phone with them, I finally gave up and decided to eat the loss. Don't make the same mistake!
customer_reviews.author: Casey Heeg

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality assurance
customer_reviews.text: This is the way that the product came to me right out of the box as you can see the right lens is 90° off and it is not secure in the housing this is totally unacceptable
customer_reviews.author: Randolph Robbins

customer_reviews.title: but before I broke them I liked them! Had them mounted on a tripod and ...
customer_reviews.text: I HAD a pair of these.....they took a 30 foot fall and didn't survive, but before I broke them I liked them! Had them mounted on a tripod and found them helpful in long distance viewing. I didn't have them long enough to see how they held up....the replacement pair I got was this brand but more powerful lens and they didn't hold up to short term regular use. I gave them a low rating and trashed them. I think I"m done with the celestron binos....maybe their telescopes are better, I've found that with optics you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: JRL

customer_reviews.title: Great deal but were defective on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a great deal for a refurbished pair- an Amazon deal. Great packaging, everything was in the box. But these binoculars would not stay in a fixed position. In that you have a half of each binocular in each hand and move them up and down to fit your eyes- my pair were very loose and would not stay in position. very irritating when you want to look at something. I returned them and plan on buying a new unit. the binoculars were OK. Not the sharpest view, but very acceptable at this price point. I have not had great luck with Amazon refurbished products in the past- I was hopeful this would be different.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good but not good enough and its less than 25 power
customer_reviews.text: Pro, looks good and seems well built, good field of view and clarity is fair. Cons, like others have said it is not 25 power---compared to other good binoculars that I have I would say around 18 power. There is some very slight distortion that you cant focus out. Like others have said eye cups are too big and dont fit well over bridge of nose. I returned these. Pay attention to the more negative reviews. Too bad that now a days Amazon buries most of the more negative reviews to the back pages instead of putting the most current reviews to the front like they used to do.
customer_reviews.author: fire105

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for low light level watching
customer_reviews.text: The problems were : (1) the part of the body the tripod adapter connects to was too thin and the binoculars kept shaking (vibrating) which made impossible seeing objects at low light levels/night sky watching); (2) the tripod adapter connects to binoculars way behind the center of mass and this makes shaking even worse. I tried to extend the connection to the tripod adapter to have it somehow balanced (closer to the center of mass- see the 1inch spacer attached to the binoculars body and to adapter) - this helped a bit, but because of the design flaw described in (1) due to vibrations/instability sky watching at night was impossible. Day image quality was OK but not great.
customer_reviews.author: Clean air

customer_reviews.title: Wiggly mount needs replacing, and you'll need a sturdy tripod.  Otherwise, golden!
customer_reviews.text: For their weight, a sturdy tripod mount is needed. The tripod mount it comes with is not sufficient. I had to purchase a metal one for about ten smackers so add that to your cost estimate when purchasing. Also, unless you have some tripods around like I do, you'll need to get one. These binoculars are heavy and large as expected, and they have nice focus at magnification. Even with the wiggly mount, I was able to get some decent pics with my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Rampant Online Consumer

customer_reviews.title: People are quick to say, “Wow, that’s a pair of binoculars!”
customer_reviews.text: Two photos taken from Aquatic Park SERC South End Rowing Club through my iPhone 7plusAs chance would have it, binoculars arrived on a Full Moon These 25x70s are perfect for viewing the moon, but terrestrial viewing is my main use, and they exceed my expectations. You can’t get a better pair for the price. They open up a world of close-up inspection. I use them mostly on San Francisco Bay, looking at sailboats, container ships, Alcatraz, seabirds, Golden Gate Bridge, conifers blanketing the hill at Kirby Cove, distant Sausalito and can even see people in the Marin Headlands.
customer_reviews.author: Conifer

customer_reviews.title: Five Star Product Four Star Review
customer_reviews.text: I fell in love with the first pair received but had to return as they were out of collimation. The second pair are collimated but cannot stop comparing the two sets. Others have expressed the pain of having to choose better than I have, (Something about one good telescope and his parasitic friend). Without question 25mm x 70mm is the real deal. Images appear multi-dimentional framed with just enough border to be reassured the entire item is in view. Animals believing themselves to be bathed in darkness are well seen. At dusk I can see stars before they become visible with the naked eye.
customer_reviews.author: Lego Sailplane10

customer_reviews.title: better view than my telescope
customer_reviews.text: I have a 90 mm telescope and these binoculars have better light gathering and a sharper image than the telescope. I was able to see Saturn and it's rings and Jupiter and it's moons with these, great for looking at constellations and nebulae. I recommend buying a good tripod to help steady them.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: If it is not a telescope, it has to be this beauty!
customer_reviews.text: With the right tripod and camera you will get an amazing view of the moon. You will be to see planets as will but do not expect pictures you see from HST BUT you will see even the moons of Jupiter in a clear enough night. And to my great surprise, you can even see some DSO like Andromeda (M31) AND EVEN star clusters like Great Pegasus Cluster (M15)!! It is not like what you would see from a telescope but it is close to it. Would be Ideal to use if you want to buy a telescope but want to start with binoculars first!
customer_reviews.author: VirtualFatass

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to culminate  it.
customer_reviews.text: Well I read all the reviews before I ordered this one I was aware it was going to probably be out of culmination when I got it and it was I went back to a couple of the reviews that actually showed you where the adjustment screws were and how to align it took me about 20 minutes but it worked and now it very clear picture pretty happy with it seems that a lot of the other people are confused that there's are out of culmination to and it's not just the right lens they're trying to adjust but oh well they'll figure it out hopefully
customer_reviews.author: Gmanfal

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted these to work, unfortunately, they cast the worst double image and make them unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Pepper power

customer_reviews.title: A bit hard to use
customer_reviews.text: This binocular does offer good zooming, which I really like. But, when I hold this in my hand, sometimes it causes dark spot in the vision. I don't know what causes it. If I change the way I'm holding it, it goes away or comes back. It may be a user error, so I didn't deduct any star for it, but I thought I'd mention it still. A definite downside is, it is very heavy. I ended up purchasing a tripod stand for it. It's a good product for the price though.
customer_reviews.author: Passerby

customer_reviews.title: Needs a sturdy tripod
customer_reviews.text: the optics are good enough to see excellent detail on the moon's surface for instance. however, given the long magnification of the binoculars combined with their hefty weight makes holding them steady in your hands difficult. I bought a tripod to use, but found out it was not sturdy enough or tall enough for good utility. So get a tripod that can extend to 6 feet in height and make sure it is sturdy. You will also need an adapter to fit to the tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Fuentes

customer_reviews.title: it's okay. But not very useful without image stabiliztion
customer_reviews.text: The optics is amazing, especially for the price. However, keep in mind that you absolutely need some kind of stabilization. At x25 it is very shaky and not useful. The mount for the tripod wasn't great but that could partially related to adapter or tripod that I used. I returned this binoculars. The optics was amazing, the price is very low for that kind of optics. But I don't find it useful without stabilization. If you buy these binoculars, you will need a very good tripod and adapter for sure. Probably more expensive than binoculars themselves
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't ask for more
customer_reviews.text: My first real opportunity to use this was in the dark skies west of Parker, Arizona where I went to observe the Geminid meteor shower on Dec 12-14, 2018. My only regret from that night is I wasn't sure how to attach the tripod mount (you must UNSCREW the logo piece on the bridge between the barrels - it doesn't "pop" off and seems like it's integral but it's not). The images are crisp, and it's spectacular for astronomical observations! You'll be amazed at the clarity and size of the Orion Nebula and Andromeda Galaxy! It's worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Byrne

customer_reviews.title: Needed collimation
customer_reviews.text: The optics on these binoculars are potentially pretty good but the pair I received (and this is a common complaint with these Chinese built units) is that they have not been collimated. I had to remove the leatherette coverings to access the adjusting screws and correct the image using a solid tripod and a distant target. I guess that's why they are as affordable as they are. AT least the original USA-made Celestrons could be counted on the work right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Gray

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Amazing Amazing
customer_reviews.text: At the price these are - well amazing doesn't cover it. Because at any price these are totally remarkable. Anyone picking on them in any way has personal issues. Do not listen. If you want to see a long way, totally clear - pull the trigger. I have had my pair for years and gave them as a house present when I stayed with someone in a penthouse in Panama. I am buying another pair - exact same ones. I use them when I fly - remarkable. Just buy them and go someplace where you can use them and have more fun than you can shake a stick at. Extraordinary craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Aficionado

customer_reviews.title: Great resolution. Needs a strong Tripod.
customer_reviews.text: Get a good tripod for this one. The tripod adapter comes with the kit, so don’t order an additional one as I did. The unit is great but you need support to view through it. A solid, not plastic camera tripod, is required. Take time to fit it to your needs and focus both for star gazing and terrestrial viewing. Celestron makes great products, this is one of them. Great value for the money, nice simple packaging and accessories. Get it but get a strong tripod.
customer_reviews.author: MSC

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner binoculars
customer_reviews.text: Asked a local astronomer about a telescope for an 8 yr old. She recommended binoculars to start. Very happy with this purchase. They are easy to use for a kid because you use both eyes. We do use them in conjunction with a tripod. If not, they would be really difficult to keep still to see so far away because they are pretty large and heavy. It is fun to look at the moon, visible planets, etc.
customer_reviews.author: chinou2

customer_reviews.title: Works great to view our 1 square mile ranch
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought these binoculars because we needed something to help us decipher what was moving on our ranch. It was antelope but when you are almost a mile from the movement, it's difficult to tell what it is. Not more! These binoculars bring everything on our property into clear view and we can even see small birds clearly enough to tell what they are. Great investment for us.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Rojo

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother for Night Sky
customer_reviews.text: The product does not perform as it was described. In fact, my 200mm DSLR lenses does a much better job. We used a professional tripod, but the only "heavenly" object that we could make out clearly was the Moon and it was full of aberrations. It works great for trees or objects in the distance during the day; but that is not what I purchased it for. Long story short, it got sent back.
customer_reviews.author: WoodStockGranny

customer_reviews.title: Just like a lot of others these are messed up out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Like others have mentioned, They are messed up out of the box.The adjustment is off and no matter what, you see 2 of the same thing (star, planet) I guess I can screw around and try to adjust but really feel I should not have to. Not happy, probably going to return super disappointing. bought nice tripod, bought the heavy duty binocular adapter. Doesn't matter these are not right. Super disappointing buying something to do outside for a new hobby during pandemic and the product is not correct.
customer_reviews.author: Silvertone

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Super nice. I saw some mad reviews about the pic being out of focus straight out of the box, but I don’t think people realize you can adjust the clarity by gripping and turning the right eye piece. Tutorials on YouTube. Mine work great. I did buy a separate metal tripod attachment at the recommendation of these reviews and was glad I did. The moon is beautiful seeing it up close
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I highly suggest using a good quality tripod and purchasing a better mount than the ...
customer_reviews.text: First pair of astronomical binocs I've owned! I highly suggest using a good quality tripod and purchasing a better mount than the included one. I was able to find Mars, Jupiter and some of its moons, Venus, Mercury, very easily. I think with a more stable surface (I was observing from a wood deck) and a better stabilized tripod (I suggest sandbags or something to help with that) I would have a better time.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas G

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, bright images
customer_reviews.text: These binoculars offer excellent light-gathering and sharp images. I use them for birding when long-distance viewing is required, such as seeing faraway waterfowl or raptors. For these purposes they are a good alternative to a scope as they are much more convenient to carry and they do not require a tripod. They weigh roughly double what my regular binoculars do, which is fine -- when held properly the extra weight is barely noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: cant focus, not one image
customer_reviews.text: no matter what i do, out of focus on anything near (like across the street) or far (a full moon). planets that can be seen clearly with a pair of cheap binoculars are fuzzy in this thing. even tried mounting on tri-pod - no help. adjusting never gives one image. called the company, on hold for 1 HOUR 10 MINUTES ... nothing. if i had not thrown the box away by mistake i would demand a refund. read the reviews carefully (wish i had) - serious focus issues. wasted money. by the way, the smart phone extra adapter is a joke -
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Buey

customer_reviews.title: Product is of POOR Quality 2nd item same problem
customer_reviews.text: Only used three times, the last time I used it, the focus wheel stopped working and would not go up or down. I did not resize the time for return to Amazon was expired. I would highly recommend you not buy this product. Return this item and received another one. Same thing happened again. This produce has a major problem with the focus wheel. Do not buy this produce.
customer_reviews.author: One Bloody Mary

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. My much smaller Bushnell 12x20s are more powerful. Don't waste your money, very poor quality. For binos this big, they should be way more powerful.
customer_reviews.author: T L

customer_reviews.title: Great price for pretty good binoculars for those interested in observing sun or moon.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these instead of 20x70 which is only a few dollars less. Great binoculars for starter. The binoculars in $300 range have much better optics. But if you don't want to pay for those, these are very good for sun, moon and planetary observations. For the price of $65, these are great binoculars. Good compromise between the 20x 70 and 25x100. Used it for the 2017 solar eclipse (with home made filter kit). You get a good field of view.
customer_reviews.author: ASA

customer_reviews.title: One descrepency
customer_reviews.text: I received it and,was happy with everything except there was a piece of debris between the lenses on the right side that couldn't be cleaned. Therefore,I returned it. The return was simple. Kind of a pain though because,it took time to drive to UPS to return. I then elected to purchase the 20x80 pair for slightly more money. Hopefully this pair will be good.
customer_reviews.author: twilliamsuamc

customer_reviews.title: Great for star gazing
customer_reviews.text: These work really well . I STRONGLY suggest getting a tripod for them . Just trying to view something by simply holding them will not work out very well , too hard to maintain a clear image without a stable base for them . Thought maybe just resting my arms on a railing would stabilize them enough , not really . Great for star gazing . Unreal how much more you can see with these .
customer_reviews.author: Min

customer_reviews.title: The most important thing is the reach, it is excellent to see the moon.
customer_reviews.text: I like the scope, you can see the moon in excellent detail, the craters look great. I recommend buying a tripod, since the weight of the binoculars makes it a bit difficult to keep the stars aligned. Very good to start the observation of the moon and stars, children really enjoy observing the universe and are surprised because they see many more stars than can be seen with the naked eye.
customer_reviews.author: Holver Hurtado

customer_reviews.title: Great binoculars
customer_reviews.text: Great magnification. Bought a tripod with it. Recommend a tripod. Because of the high magnification, just a small movement of your hands will cause a jittery view. Plus, these are large binoculars. I even put my iPhone up to one of the lenses (without an iPhone holder - which I would recommend if you plan to take pics) and took a pic of the moon. It turned out pretty good. You can even see craters.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Lowrey

customer_reviews.title: Dope
customer_reviews.text: I also bought the 15x70 and man...these things are awesome in comparison. I couldn't get my eyes fixed on both lens together, in the 15x70. But these........I even ended buying a stand for these badboys! -small con I won't even deduct a star for because I'm not even an amateur astronomer. There is some dust in my lens. The REASON I won't deduct a star is because its not visible when your eyes are pressed to the eyepieces. I realize this is a huge deal for most astronomers and photographers but this is just my opinion as used by me.
customer_reviews.author: Das

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunate small black line in left lens
customer_reviews.text: I like these binoculars. I bought them for viewing lake activities, typically within 2 miles. Not too heavy, stabilization is fine without tripod, focus function is fine, optics are good, except... small black line in the left lens. It is internal and cannot be cleaned. I like these enough that I considered living with the black line, but just can’t. Returning first pair but will reorder.
customer_reviews.author: CJK

customer_reviews.title: I Love these Binoculars by Celestron!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these based on reviews. These are awesome binoculars for viewing the stars, clear crisp images. They are heavy and because of the small field of view, you will definitely need a tripod. Did not use the tripod adaptor provided that came with the binoculars, instead purchased the BARSKA binocular tripod adaptor which works perfectly. Would recommend using a very sturdy tripod, maybe a heavier duty tripod.
customer_reviews.author: CWW1964

customer_reviews.title: Great magnification, slightly "hazy" optics
customer_reviews.text: For recreational use and occasional nighttime viewing, this model made good sense for our needs. Build quality is good, and the included (plastic) tripod adapter works well. The only downside is slightly hazy optics. I have a pair of smaller, less expensive REI binoculars that are crystal clear by comparison. But given the occasional use these get, they are more than adequate.
customer_reviews.author: NH_Willamette_Valley

customer_reviews.title: No Tripod Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: it's hard to see the moon or planets, when I try to watch the moon without moving the moon is moving all directions like crazy and I was already having pain in my eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value binoculars!
customer_reviews.text: Great clarify, acuity, and magnification. Excellent purchase. Difficult to use without a tripod (heavy) but well worth the additional hardware.
customer_reviews.author: BletchleyPark1939

customer_reviews.title: Never again
customer_reviews.text: They look better in my trash barrel. Extreme double image.
customer_reviews.author: kenkeyessr

customer_reviews.title: Crisp view
customer_reviews.text: Ok...I originally had a pair of 15×70s that I loved. Unfortunately, they broke and I ordered the 25×70s. They are awesome. Crisp, clear views(the moon looks like you could reach out and touch it). They are heavy just like the 15×70s, so I would suggest a tripod. If you are looking for a really great pair of astronomy binoculars, these are it.
customer_reviews.author: penny l.

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: I have a Celestron telescope and other products. This is a great pair of binoculars but keep in mind that with this magnification you really need a stable hand. For basic use such as the moon, I would recommend to go down to a lower magnification for better stability. Quality is great as always from Celestron.
customer_reviews.author: Kalle

customer_reviews.title: A great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: A great bang for the buck. I haven't had a chance to use them much but did take them out the other night. When pointing them at what appeared to be maybe a handful of maybe three or four stars I observed literally hundreds if not thousands of stars in that spot. I will probably get a stronger telescope at some point as well but this binocular looks like a fun way to observe the heavens without a making a huge investment. Great for a young astronomer or to carry in the truk of your car just in case. I'm sure they will work just as well for other objects such as scenery and wildlife ....
customer_reviews.author: Gibson60

customer_reviews.title: It had a cheap price but...
customer_reviews.text: For the price the quality was expected. However, being new to binoculars and star gazing this thing needs a solid solid tripod and adapter. Too much zoom for any kind of viewing though. The moon is so close that it takes up the entire field of vision and shakes so much since its so zoomed. Go with a lower zoom and I think you will be happier.
customer_reviews.author: TCP

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and performance
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and performance. Get a tripod and get a METAL adaptor. I got the BARSKA adaptor here on Amazon and it make a HUGE difference. The plastic tripod adaptor was pretty much useless because of the shaking. It is worth the 8 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: t sosa

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality - lens coating missing
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality lens coating. The lens coating was missing and flaking (see pictures) as soon as received and opened. Don’t know how much impacts the image. Got them as a gift, but should have returned them right away.
customer_reviews.author: parentbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Great, but bulky for hiking.
customer_reviews.text: Brought to Death Valley, Sequoia and Kings Canyon, and Yosemite National parks. Bulky in the pack for hiking but the optics are great. Used them for stargazing in Death Valley, you could see the Galilean moons. The attach photo was from the top of panoramic point in Sequoia. I was able to line up my iPhone with the eye relief.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a highly versatile product. It is also an incredible bargain! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Another great product in the Celestron line of binoculars. Great clarity and distance for portable binoculars. There are many inexpensive tripods availabile that can be used to steady the binoculars for viewing the stars. These Celestron binoculars an be used equally for terrestrial spotting of land objects. Great value for the price you pay to enjoy these wonderful binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Cohan

customer_reviews.title: What a great deal on these binoculars. A great product shipped quickly.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with these. The only thing I wished that they had done was pack the item ib another carton over the product box. It arrived in the store box as you'd see on the shelf. The box was crushed but the binoculars thank God were OK. Packing should have been better.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S

customer_reviews.title: The 'Third times a Charm' - first two had issues
customer_reviews.text: The first binocular to arrive appeared to work well, but had something rattling inside the left large lens I asked for a return/exchange. The second binocular had a collimation issue, where the lenses are not aligned and the image is a double vision as if you are looking at something cross-eyed. I asked for another return/exchange. The third unit worked fine. In hindsight, I should have been more wary of the full range of reviews as there were several of them that discussed the same types of issues with this model.
customer_reviews.author: chinkle

customer_reviews.title: Decent pair of binoculars
customer_reviews.text: These binoculars are actually better than expected for the reasonable price. Very good collimation and they focus acceptably. The one fault I noticed was that the field of view is not as flat as it could be. The center two thirds of the field of view are well focused, but further out becomes blurrier to the edge. This is probably a compromise by the manufacturer to provide a wider field of view, and, since most observing is done near the center, the out of focus edges are less of an issue. I would recommend these for a budget pair of 25X binoculars with good light gathering ability.
customer_reviews.author: Stargazerneil

customer_reviews.title: A lot of zoom for good price
customer_reviews.text: This bino is a great tool to have whether hiking, star gazing, etc. It's quite large, and you either need a tripod or lean your elbows on something stable in order for the picture not to rattle too much. The optics are good for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Assaf

customer_reviews.title: Second pair
customer_reviews.text: I was able to see the craters of the moon from new york city with the binoculars. worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A Fonseca

customer_reviews.title: Esh! Many problems! buy a different brand!
customer_reviews.text: I was really hopeful it would be a good binocular. I received the binocular and it was severely out of collimation. Double vision was terrible and made the binocular unusable. I attempted to align the binocular today and managed to get it aligned. After getting it aligned the diopter eye piece fell off. I am going to contact customer service to see if they can resolve the issue. If they can help I will do a second review of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda DeYoung

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, powerful, needs individual focus
customer_reviews.text: This is nice, powerful, and stylish. Gives a great view of the skies and anything else you point it at - looking at architecture is also pretty great. Unfortunately, it's also really heavy; the weight wears me down after a bit, and it's sometimes hard to keep steady (and I'm over six feet tall; smaller people would probably have more problems). Also, if the focus on each lens gets out of alignment, it's pretty tough to get them back together; there's only one knob that adjusts both at once. Still, I bought this for power, and it's great for that.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Gunn

customer_reviews.title: Works better than my Sports Afield Spotting scope
customer_reviews.text: Well Worth the price! Works better than my Sports Afield Spotting scope. I haven't seen any of the Collumation problem some people have experienced. Coincidentally, a Goodyear blimp came by today and I could see right into the Pilot/Passenger basket. Looked as can clear as could be expected. I live on the coast and the ocean mist/fog greys out the colors sometimes. But so far the binoculars look great!
customer_reviews.author: PrimeDirective

customer_reviews.title: See the world bigger.
customer_reviews.text: Great product gives you great field of view letting you view stuff that would be lost in a distance. Because of the power obtained. To keep a stable view I recommend the use of a tripod for sky viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I really like everything about these binoculars. They're extremely affordable and give you a great view of the night sky. I've seen nebulae, clusters, planets and a host of other things. I would suggest a tripod for looking at something longer than a few moments. They're a bit heavy and hard to hold still for longer than a few moments. But, with a tripod, you can easily discern the rings of Saturn, the moons of Jupiter, and the wispy clouds of the Orion nebula. Even in heavy light pollution. I carry them with me everywhere I go just in case I find myself under dark skies.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good basic binocs.
customer_reviews.text: Tested by looking at road signs, passing planes, tops of trees and stars. Works fine. Was able to focus to get clear images. This does not have zoom so it is full magnification all the time. Not heavy enough to tire you out while using.
customer_reviews.author: A Simple

customer_reviews.title: Buy a metal tripod adapter
customer_reviews.text: The binos themselves are very nice, sharp picture quality. The tripod adapter they come with is trash, you just breath on the binoculars when they are attached and the plastic starts to twist and your image is instantly ruined. When you order these go ahead and order the metal tripod adapter, you will be much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great binoculars for stargazing
customer_reviews.text: very nice quality. 25x is a good magnification and 70mm lets in a lot of light for stargazing. highly recommend mounting on a tripod at this magnification though.
customer_reviews.author: J. Schoppert

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t compare to a good telescope. Main advantages, portable and lightweight. For a quick look at the Moon I guess that would be the real benefit. Everything else in the sky requires much better magnification.
customer_reviews.author: toddisit

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: My husband has really enjoyed these. We got them in July and he’s used them several times. You can see great when they sky is clear. Next gift might be a stand, as these are hard to get in the correct place and keep them there... but that’s with high powered vision item. It’s hard to keep a steady hand. We would recommend these for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super closeup
customer_reviews.text: We live on a lake and there is plenty of wildlife around. These allow us to get up close and see details we could never have. I do wish they had image stabilization. At 25x, it's really shaky and makes it hard to take advantage of the fairly crisp images.
customer_reviews.author: $HP

customer_reviews.title: They work great until they break.
customer_reviews.text: These are probably the best binoculars you can get for $70. I got mine 5 years ago and they worked great until the focuser broke. The first time this happened the binoculars were under warranty. I will not be purchasing again. We careful of build quality and be conscious that these are $70.
customer_reviews.author: misty denman

customer_reviews.title: Not Good for Small PD; heavy
customer_reviews.text: My pupillary distance (distance between your pupils) is normal for a woman but on the small side for unisex frames (I can't wear men's glasses frames), and these binoculars would not adjust closely enough for me to see a single image. When looking at the moon through one eyepiece with one eye, the magnification was good. They were also heavier and longer than I expected. I returned them with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: POWERFUL! Wow!
customer_reviews.text: These are POWERFUL. Almost too powerful. You should use a good tripod (on a solid surface) when using. I am keeping them but buying a less powerful optics for the boat. Solid design and build. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: John d

customer_reviews.title: Under the right grip is a very small screw where ...
customer_reviews.text: Under the right grip is a very small screw where you can align the lenses. You need to peel back the rubber grip at the corner and with a little screwdriver you can tweak the images until aligned.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use & adjust! Perfect for sailing!
customer_reviews.text: I was wanting pair of binoculars I could take right out of the box and start using! If you want the same experience then BUY THESE! I am very happy and they do exactly what I want them to do. I go sailing and always want to look on small islands nearby and they are perfect for that!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing clarity!
customer_reviews.text: Omg!!! These are amazing! The clarity and quality are well worth the price. They have been great for bird watching and star/moon gazing! My parents bought a pair after trying mine they were so impressed! Def recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: FawnBoston

customer_reviews.title: Great views!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Was able to see stars we can’t see normally. Took on a trip to Vegas and was able to see through the mountains very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: M M P

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair similar to these and they were way to heavy for most people to hold for any amount of time. These binoculars are a lighter pair with great viewing and very sharp viewing. Fun to use for many different occasions.
customer_reviews.author: Edward A. Sampadian

customer_reviews.title: I like my binoculars
customer_reviews.text: I searched and came across the good feedback on these. I liked the specs so decided to go with it. For the price, I'm very happy. They are light enough to hold which I love. I tried some binoculars my dad had and you cannot hold them because they were SO heavy. Also, it was very difficult to move his around because the tripod was also heavy. Getting back to these, I would buy again if I had to. I now live up and have a city view. This is why I purchased these. You can see things in the distance that you cannot see by eye...... It really is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Love Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Hand held telescope!
customer_reviews.text: You can almost see into the future with them! They work great and optics are very good. Yes you will like them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: Opinion pending on tech support
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to tell if they're good or not. The magnification is certainly the strongest I have seen, but the binocular vision is off so that there are two images floating near each other. You can't really tell if the image is good or not. With the magnification as strong as it is, everything is very wiggly. You'll want a very heavy duty tripod for a still image. I'm seeking support from Celestron, so I'll edit the review if and when that process is complete.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin GD

customer_reviews.title: Focus makes it unusable
customer_reviews.text: These binoculars do not seem to want to focus on anything beyond a few hundred feet. The ring stops before anything comes into view. How are these supposed to be used for astronomy when I can’t even focus to 100 yards away?
customer_reviews.author: Levi Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great binoculars but...
customer_reviews.text: I really like this binoculars, the view is crisp and sharp. I use them with a tripod but what realyy dissapointed me is that the third time I used them with it, when I put the tripod adaptor, the plastic piece of it broke. Now is extremely difficult to adjust the tripod adapter, considering that you have to use it to properly focus because the weight of the binoculars, it's very inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalo Gustavo Zapata Talledo

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and good viewing from a distance
customer_reviews.text: These do work to bring things in closer, but they are quite heavy and difficult to hold by hand and see items without moving around. We have to use them on a tripod to be able to focus them properly. However, if you want to see things from a distance, these will do the trick. The only reason for the 4 stars is the weight and the inability to hold steady just using your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Nance

customer_reviews.title: I have a pair of the Celestron 71336 Nature DX 12x56 Binocular which are my favorite binos at the moment
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a gift for a friend of mine to mount on a tripod for viewing animals at his ranch. I was very surprised at how clear they are and how stable the image is even without using a tripod. They are not the ideal binocular for hand held use but are not designed to be. I'm just commenting on their ease of use and quality. I have a pair of the Celestron 71336 Nature DX 12x56 Binocular which are my favorite binos at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: tctopcat

customer_reviews.title: Great viewing!
customer_reviews.text: Once you get your view (according to your eye prescription if you wear glasses), the view is clear and these are great for hunting or ant outdoor activity. The craftsmanship is pretty good, too. The only drawback is that they get heavy after a couple of minutes. Then again, I'm not a young man anymore.....
customer_reviews.author: George McCall

customer_reviews.title: very amazing
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a good binoculars because of the Celestron Brand and sure enough I got what I wanted! This pair is amazing, the clairiity is superb!! I'm glad I bought this brand, worth every penny I paid for it!!!
customer_reviews.author: only4me

customer_reviews.title: Raised price and didn't replace.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived missing neck strap, lens Cloth, and rain guard. Returned and requested replacement. Amazon refunded $$$$ to store card instead.
customer_reviews.author: Zeno Nine

customer_reviews.title: Love these as my first set
customer_reviews.text: These are working better for me than the binoculars. I love them! They work very well with my glasses, too. They do get a little heavy after awhile, so I am waiting on a tripod to help with that.
customer_reviews.author: Té

customer_reviews.title: Returned them
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for. I replaced them with Nikon Monarch 5 10X42. Cost $296 but a world of difference.
customer_reviews.author: Frank C

customer_reviews.title: Great company. Very heavy definitely need a tripod and some practice focusing
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy definitely need a tripod. Also for those of you like myself that have a very dominant eye Binoculars are just hard to use. Also difficult with glasses. Returned
customer_reviews.author: Jules66

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE
customer_reviews.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE these Bio's. I'm a retire vet and I have a home close (about 2miles) to a airborne drop zone and now I can see them exiting the door of the C130 or C141 airplane from by back yard. These are a great purchase for me!!!
customer_reviews.author: MITCHELL SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Great product 👍👌
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: It's been 2 months and I can't stop loving this bundle of joy :) ------- Two and three stars are for the weight and size of the binacular but it does really good job of focusing clearly. The size and weight is expected for the power of the binacular.
customer_reviews.author: Sakar Bhusal

customer_reviews.title: Good image quality, but heavy
customer_reviews.text: These give a really good image quality, but they are heavy. Your arms will get tired trying to hold at the target.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Still waiting for refund
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t get them to fully focus after following directions many times. Retired them weeks ago, but still no refund. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Petroff

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyone but excellent
customer_reviews.text: These are powerful and really need a tripod. But...excellent for the price. Very happy to have purchased
customer_reviews.author: Beth Jeffries

customer_reviews.title: Probably fine for just sightseeing
customer_reviews.text: Probably fine for just sightseeing. Very grainy and no definition if you're going to use for glassing game. They work fine if you don't care about counting points on a elk or deer rack at 1000 yards. Also they pick up heat thermals in the air, like any other high-power optics.
customer_reviews.author: Gulaman

customer_reviews.title: Good but too heavy to hand hold
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife's Christmas present; their primary use will be for bird and wildlife watching. She loves the clarity and magnification, but couldn't really use them until we put them on a decent tripod. Some instructions on how to remove the threaded cap to expose the screw hole for the tripod mount would have been helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff W in GA

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Horrible delivery experience,it took a long month to deliver,lenses cover very cheap rubber with no attachment,shaky picture
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted. Can see activity at edge of our property easily. I must say that you get best results if you have a heavy duty tripod
customer_reviews.author: Farmwife

product_meta.title: Celestron - SkyMaster 25x70 Binocular - Large Aperture Binoculars with 70mm Objective Lens - 25x Magnificiation High Powered Binoculars - Includes Carrying Case
product_meta.description: Style:SkyMaster 25x70 Binocular| Configuration:BinocularCelestron’s Sky Master series of large aperture binoculars are a phenomenal value for high performance binoculars ideal for astronomical viewing or for terrestrial (land) use - especially over long distances. Each Sky Master model features high quality BaK-4 prisms and multi-coated optics for enhanced contrast. Celestron has designed and engineered the larger Sky Master models to meet the special demands of extended astronomical or terrestrial viewing sessions.
feature_bullets: Large 70 mm objective lens offers maximum image brightness in low-light and long-range conditions
Ultra sharp focus across the field of view. Linear Field of View (@1000 yds.) / @1000 m): 141 feet (47 m)Exit Pupil: 0. 11 inches. Eye Relief: 0. 51 inches
Multi-coated optics for sharp, clear views
Suitable for terrestrial or astronomical viewing. Ipd max: 2. 83 inch
Protective rubber covering for ultra-firm grip
Long eye relief ideal for eyeglass wearers

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,171 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
